intro: Saponaria pinetorum var. elatior, commonly known as the greater soapwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often hairy. Saponaria pinetorum var. elatior is valued in gardens for its ornamental flowers and its historical use in soap-making due to the saponins it contains.
